meaning: Critical assessment of a process or activity or of their results.
example: After you hand in your essays, I will give both grades and feedback.

meaning: A ship used to transport people, smaller vehicles and goods from one port to another, usually on a regular schedule.
example: Trucks plowed through the water to ferry flood victims to safety.

meaning: To make final or firm; to finish or complete.
example: As soon as we get the plane tickets, we'll finalize our reservations with the hotel.

meaning: A person who puts out fires.

A device using gunpowder and other chemicals which, when lit, emits a combination of coloured flames, sparks, whistles or bangs, and sometimes made to rocket high into the sky before exploding, used for entertainment or celebration.
example: Commercial firework displays are commonly launched from boats or other vessels

meaning: A public official in certain countries having control of public revenue.
The condition of being fit, suitable or appropriate.
Something that is fixed in place, especially a permanent appliance or other item of personal property that is considered part of a house and is sold with it; compare fitting, furnishing.
example: The device is available in both handheld and fixtured models.

meaning: The quality produced by the sensation of taste or, especially, of taste and smell in combined effect.
example: The flavor of this apple pie is delicious.

meaning: A flake, fragment, or shiver.
example: That vase has a flaw.

meaning: A group of vessels or vehicles.
The quality of being flexible; suppleness; pliability.
example: I had some flexibility in terms of whether to stay in a hotel or in a bed-and-breakfast.

meaning: An arrangement that allows employees to set their own working hours within agreed limits; normally must include certain periods (core time) when they must be at work.
Powder obtained by grinding or milling cereal grains, especially wheat, or other foodstuffs such as soybeans and potatoes, and used to bake bread, cakes, and pastry.
example: mustard flour

meaning: Influenza.
To vary irregularly; to swing.
example: I fluctuated between wishing he was back home and wishing I'd never met him.

meaning: A continuous variable, especially one with respect to time in Newton's Method of Fluxions.
example: fluent handwriting

meaning: That which flies, as a bird or insect.
A thick cloud that forms near the ground; the obscurity of such a cloud.
example: He did so many drugs, he was still in a fog three months after going through detox.

meaning: An organizer that papers are kept in, usually with an index tab, to be stored as a single unit in a filing cabinet.
example: I keep all my schoolwork in a yellow folder.

meaning: Items or an item of clothing that is worn on the foot; a shoe, sandal, etc.
To disallow; to proscribe.
example: Smoking in the restaurant is forbidden.

meaning: The leader of a work crew.
A pronged tool having a long straight handle, used for digging, lifting, throwing etc.
example: West Fork White River and East Fork White River join together to form the White River of Indiana.

meaning: In a formal manner.
example: He was dressed too formally for the occasion.

meaning: In a fortunate manner.
example: Fortunately, Sam's pet hamster was not dead.

meaning: A place for discussion.
example: Trish was an admin on three forums, and had no trouble at all when it came to moderating them.

meaning: A foster parent.
example: Some fosters end up adopting.

meaning: One who founds or establishes (especially said of a company, project, organisation, state)
example: the founder of Facebook, Mark Zuckerberg

meaning: A natural source of water; a spring.
example: Lava fountained from the volcano.

meaning: The right to vote at a public election or referendum; see: suffrage, suffragette.
example: McDonalds has exported its franchise.

meaning: Someone who sells their services to clients without a long-term employment contract.
example: He was a freelance writer for several magazines.

meaning: Payment for transportation.
example: The freight was more expensive for cars than for coal.

meaning: One who loads a ship, or one who charters and loads a ship.
To disappoint or defeat; to vex by depriving of something expected or desired.
example: It frustrates me to do all this work and then lose it all.

meaning: (usually in the plural, fries) A fried strip of potato.
example: to be in a fry

meaning: To raise funds for a specified cause or purpose.
example: Daniel's uncle volunteered to help fundraise for his nephew's class trip to Chile

meaning: Material used to create an engineered product.
A unit of volume, equivalent to eight pints
example: The pipe burst and gallons of water flooded into the kitchen.

meaning: A building (or section of a building) used to store a car or cars, tools and other miscellaneous items.
example: We garaged the convertible during the monsoon months.

meaning: Food waste material of any kind.
example: Garbage is collected on Tuesdays; rubbish on Fridays

meaning: One who gardens; one who grows plants or cultivates a garden.
example: "Ponder the fact that God has made you a gardener, to root out vice and to plant virtue." — St. Catherine of Siena

meaning: A single item of clothing.
A flammable liquid consisting of a mixture of refined petroleum hydrocarbons, mainly used as a motor fuel; petrol.
example: The refinery produces a wide range of gasolines.
